text: Teacher@Hello, Glen, so glad to have you in our class finally. I hope you enjoyed looking round the school earlier, we do our best for the pupils.
Teacher@I've put you next to Connor, down at the front here. I think you two will make great friends!
The class@G o o d  m o r n i n g  M r s  T h o m s o n .
Teacher@As some of you might have noticed, we've got a new pupil in the class.
The class@H e l l o .
Teacher@If you remember last Friday, I said that on this week we would be moving onto English lessons.
Teacher@As you get older, you will need to write a lot, so it is important that you know how to how to spell correctly.
Teacher@I've prepared a fun exercise for you all that will help you learn the correct words for things.
Teacher@Everyone should have a small box on their desk.
Teacher@I want everyone to think of words they known. It can be any word, it can be an object, or a word you just really like to say.
Teacher@When you've thought up a word, I want you to write it down, and drop it in your box.
Teacher@Don't worry if you don't know how to spell a word, just write it down and I will be around to give any help.
Teacher@Yes, cat is a word. You can put that in the box.
